did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.repository: Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center.
did.abstract: Photographs of steam and electric locomotives of the New York, New Haven & Hartford Railroad, in the 1950s.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Mr. Melbourne Preston, born in 1906 or 1907 on North Street in West Haven, Connecticut, was a locomotive engineer for the New York, New Haven & Hartford Railroad from the 1930s to his retirement in 1971. He was also an amateur photographer.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of 47 photographs of steam and electric locomotives of the New York, New Haven & Hartford Railroad. All of the photographs are unidentified as to date, place and photographer; it is uncertain if the photographs were taken by Mr. Preston.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Archives & Special Collections has a substantial collection of materials pertaining to the railroads of southern New England, particularly the New York, New Haven & Hartford Railroad. For detailed information on these collections please contact the curator or ask at the reference desk.
